text: Ocotea aciphylla is a species of Ocotea in the plant family Lauraceae. It forms a tree 12–18 m tall. It has small hermaphrodite flowers of 3–4 mm long. It is found in the Amazon river basin mostly to 1200 m. ==References== aciphylla Category:Trees of South America Category:Trees of the Caribbean Category:Flora of the Amazon Category:Flora of Bolivia Category:Flora of Brazil Category:Flora of Colombia Category:Flora of French Guiana Category:Flora of Guadeloupe Category:Flora of Martinique Category:Flora of Peru Category:Flora of Suriname Category:Flora of Venezuela Category:Least concern plants Category:Least concern biota of South America Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Ocotea aciphylla
